title: Can You Stream Netflix in 4K on Your iPad or iPhone?

steps.title: Make sure your Netflix plan includes 4K streaming.
steps.content: Make sure your Netflix plan includes 4K streaming. The Standard and Standard with ads plans include HD, but you need the Premium plan in order to watch 4K videos. [1] X Research source You can check this article for some help on how to change your Netflix plan.

steps.title: Check what your device supports.
steps.content: Check what your device supports. Most modern iPhones and iPads can stream 4K videos, even if they don’t display them at full 4K resolution. If you have an iPhone 8 or later or an iPad Pro, you’ll also be able to watch videos in HDR (High Dynamic Range). However, keep in mind that the highest resolution any iPhone or iPad will display is 1080p. [2] X Research source For a list of supported resolutions by device, see this page from Netflix . While you’re at it, update your iPhone or iPad to the latest version of iOS , which will also help you get the best streaming quality.

steps.title: Open the Netflix app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Netflix app on your iPhone or iPad. The Netflix icon looks like a red "N" in a black square. You can find it on your home screen or in an app folder. If you haven’t already logged into your account, do so now.

steps.title: Tap My Netflix.
steps.content: Tap My Netflix . This is the option at the bottom of the screen with your user icon.

steps.title: Tap the More button.
steps.content: Tap the More button. This button looks like the " ☰ " icon on the menu bar at the top of your screen. It will open the menu.

steps.title: Tap App Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap App Settings on the menu. This will open your Netflix app's settings on a new page.

steps.title: Tap Cellular Data Usage or Mobile Data Usage.
steps.content: Tap Cellular Data Usage or Mobile Data Usage . You can find this button under the "Video Playback" heading at the top of the menu. Your options will pop up in a new window. By default, this option is set to Automatic , which means that Netflix will automatically select whichever setting gives the best balance between video quality and data usage. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select Maximum Data.
steps.content: Select Maximum Data . This setting will give you the highest possible video quality, but it will also use up the most cellular data. You’ll need to toggle off Automatic to select it.

steps.title: Tap Video Quality and select Higher (optional).
steps.content: Tap Video Quality and select Higher (optional). If you like to download Netflix videos to your device to watch offline, you can increase the quality of your downloads as well. Find this option in the "Downloads" section of App Settings. Tap Video Quality , then select Higher . This setting will affect the quality of videos that you download in the Netflix app, but it shouldn’t impact your streaming experience. You can download videos in up to 1080P or HD, but not in 4K. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Find and open a 4K show or movie and start streaming.
steps.content: Find and open a 4K show or movie and start streaming. Once you’ve adjusted your settings, look for a 4K video on Netflix. You should see the 4K symbol on the page for the movie, show, or episode if it’s available and your plan supports it.

steps.title: Try using Netflix in Safari if you still aren’t getting the best quality.
steps.content: Try using Netflix in Safari if you still aren’t getting the best quality. Some users claim that they get the best streaming quality by watching Netflix in Safari rather than in the Netflix app. If you’ve checked your plan and adjusted all your settings but still aren’t getting the video quality you want, go to https://www.netflix.com/ in your Safari browser and sign in, then stream the 4K content you want to watch.
